meanings.sent1: The school secularized its curriculum by removing all religious references.
meanings.sent2: The government secularized the holiday celebrations to be inclusive of all beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The cat secularized the house by knocking over all the religious figurines.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was secularized, free from the constraints of religious dogma.
meanings.sent5: The artist secularized the painting, turning the church scene into a peaceful landscape.

meanings.definition: To remove religious influence or significance.
meanings.sent1: The company secularized its policies, ensuring they were not influenced by any religious beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The historian secularized the ancient texts, focusing on the cultural aspects rather than the religious ones.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel secularized the garden by burying its nuts in the sacred ground.
meanings.sent4: His words were secularized, stripped of any religious undertones.
meanings.sent5: The storm secularized the church, washing away all traces of religious symbols.
